description:
In the future, most of mankind lives in artificial space colonies, climate-controlled and completely safe. The orphan girl Luna, selected to receive a scholarship at the prestigious Soria Academy, finds herself in quite different circumstances. An excursion gone terribly awry leads to Luna and her classmates being stranded on an uninhabited planet. Without any experience of untamed nature, the motley crew is faced with a challenging struggle to stay alive until rescue comes. If it comes...

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

node.description:
Round Table is a J-pop band known mostly for their anime soundtracks. They are most popularly known for their hit single, "Let Me Be With You" - the opening song for the anime Chobits. The band was formed in 1997 with Kitagawa Katsutoshi and Ito Rieko as band members. In 2002, Nino joined as a guest vocalis, providing the main vocals for the songs while Kitagawa provides backing vocals. Since then their songs have often been credited as "__Round Table featuring Nino__"
(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://www.round-table.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/ROUNDTABLETV)

__Members:__
• [Kitagawa Katsutoshi](https://anilist.co/staff/119957) (vocals, guitar, and bass guitar) 
• Ito Rieko (vocals and keyboard)
• Nino (vocals, since 2002)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/89380077) | [Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/egutihisasi/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/eguchiworks/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/HisashiEguchi)

One of Japan's most prominent illustrators of female characters.

Eguchi began drawing at an early age, fascinated by the then-starting Japanese TV broadcasting. He got to know manga through [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s [Astro Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/2747/). Other superheroes like Ultraman and Ultra Seven also gripped him. He has cited American pop artists such as Roy Lichtenstein and Andy Warhol as major influences.

In a 2017 [interview](https://youtu.be/2a6Wqq4zifw), Eguchi said that the ideal woman for him in his drawings isn't one that he would dream to date, but instead one he would've wanted to become if he was born a girl.

He has also provided original character designs for [Roujin Z](https://anilist.co/anime/2000/), [Perfect Blue](https://anilist.co/anime/437/), [Mujin Wakusei Survive](https://anilist.co/anime/709/) and [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/).

In 1990, he married the idol singer Mari Mizutani.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/滝口禎一)

Currently affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Worked at [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/) for 30 years.
Freelancer formerly affiliated with [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KA_Yuuzumi)

A Japanese director, animator, and storyboard artist who mainly does key animation and animation direction.

__Date of Birth:__ 1968
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9C%9B%E6%9C%88%E6%AD%A6)

Takeshi Mochizuki was a screenwriter.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/増田敏彦)

Affiliated with [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/滝口禎一)

Currently affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Worked at [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/) for 30 years.
